description: Passes SQL statements to a data source. Not limited to queries.
name: query

result.description:
Specifies a name for the structure in which cfquery returns
            the result variables.
            - SQL: The SQL statement that was executed. (string)
            - Cached: If the query was cached. (boolean)
            - SqlParameters: An ordered Array of cfqueryparam values. (array)
            - RecordCount: Total number of records in the query. (numeric)
            - ColumnList: Column list, comma separated. (numeric)
            - ExecutionTime: Execution time for the SQL request. (numeric)

blockfactor.description:
Specifies the maximum number of rows to fetch at a time from the server. The range is 1,
		default to 100. This parameter applies to ORACLE native database drivers and to ODBC drivers.
		Certain ODBC drivers may dynamically reduce the block factor at runtime.

dbtype.description:
support the following values:
			- query: for doing a query on a existing query object
			- hql: for doing a query on orm

unique.description: Specifies if the object parameter is unique, used only for dbtype=orm or hql

providerdsn.description: This attribute has been deprecated and is non-functional.

provider.description: This attribute has been deprecated and is non-functional.

debug.description:
Used for debugging queries. Specifying this attribute causes the SQL statement submitted to the
		data source and the number of records returned from the query to be returned.

dbserver.description: This attribute has been deprecated and is non-functional.

password.description: If specified, password overrides the password value specified in the data source setup.

returntype.description:
one of the following values:
			- query: default for all dbtype expect "hql", returns a query object
			- array_of_entity: works only with dbtype "hql" and is also the default value for dbtype "hql"

timezone.description: the timezone used to convert a date object to a timestamp (string), this value is needed when your database runs in another timezone and you are not using cfqueryparam to to insert dates.

cachedwithin.description:
Timespan, using the CreateTimeSpan function. If original
            query date falls within the time span, cached query data is
            used. CreateTimeSpan defines a period from the present,
            back. Takes effect only if query caching is enabled in the
            Administrator.

            To use cached data, the current query must use the same SQL
            statement, data source, query name, user name, and password.

username.description: If specified, username overrides the username value specified in the data source setup.

connectstring.description: This attribute has been deprecated and is non-functional.

name.description:
The name query. Must begin with a letter and may consist of letters, numbers, and the underscore
		character, spaces are not allowed. The query name is used later in the page to reference the query's
		record set.

dbname.description: This attribute has been deprecated and is non-functional.

cachedafter.description: This is the age of which the query data can be

datasource.description: The name of the data source from which this query should retrieve data.

maxrows.description: Specifies the maximum number of rows to return in the record set.

timeout.description:
The maximum number of milliseconds for the query to execute before returning an error
		indicating that the query has timed-out. This attribute is not supported by most ODBC drivers.
		timeout is supported by the SQL Server 6.x or above driver. The minimum and maximum allowable values
		vary, depending on the driver.

cachename.description: This attribute has been deprecated and is non-functional.
